articles.description: COLORADO SPRINGS, Colo. (KKTV) - This week, 30 federally threatened black-footed ferrets were released on Colorado’s eastern plains.The ferrets, one of the rarest mammals in North America, were raised at a U.S. Fish and Wildlife breeding facility. According to CPW’s website, black-footed ferrets were thought to be extinct twice, and were absent from Colorado since the early 1940s. A small population was found in Wyoming in 1981, which was used to help boost populations in the region. Officials say that there are currently about 600 black-footed ferrets both in captivity and the wild, and that all black-footed ferrets are now descendants of that population found in Wyoming.The ferrets were first reintroduced to Colorado back in 2001. This week’s release marks the eighth release site in eastern Colorado. The ferrets were released land owned by the Southern Plains Land Trust.See video of the release from Colorado Parks & Wildlife here:Copyright 2022 KKTV. All rights reserved.
articles.title: CPW releases 30 threatened black-footed ferrets in eastern Colorado - KKTV

articles.description: A fire heavily damaged a home on 25th Avenue NW and claimed the lives of at least two pets Thursday afternoon.None of the residents were harmed, Hickory Fire Department Education Coordinator Terri Byers said. Four people lived at the home, two of whom were there at the time of the fire.At least two family pets — a ferret and a cat — died in the fire, she said.The Catawba County Fire Marshal’s office ruled the fire accidental, according to a release from the Hickory Fire Department.Byers said the fire department deployed three fire engines, a ladder truck and a rescue truck. Catawba County EMS and Red Cross responded as well. Kevin Griffin is the City of Hickory reporter at the Hickory Daily Record.  Subscribe to our Daily Headlines newsletter.
articles.title: At least one cat and a ferret killed in 25th Avenue NW fire; blaze ruled accidental - Hickory Daily Record

articles.description: Ferrets are pretty cool pets. They’re friendly, smart, super curious and fun to hang out with!But when it comes to taking care of your new friend, you might be wondering — what do ferrets eat?To find out what the best foods are to feed your ferret (and those to avoid), we reached out to Samantha Henson, a certified clinical pet nutritionist with Next Generation Pet Wellness, and Dr. Robert Fillman, a veterinarian at GeoZoo (and ferret parent!).What do ferrets eat?Well, for starters, ferrets are carnivores — or more specifically, obligate carnivores. This means that their diet should consist of at least 70 percent meat.“Much like tigers, alligators and snakes, ferrets need meat to survive and cannot turn plant proteins into what their bodies need,” Henson told The Dodo. “They thrive on a di…
articles.title: What Can I Feed My Ferret? - The Dodo

articles.description: This will make you want to visit the craft store!Arts and crafts sure can be fun! Mod-podge, construction paper, pipe cleaners, glitter.. heck, why not get your pets in on the action for a little fun creative bonding time? Or, in the case of @Fuffyferrets you can wait until it's naptime and then get creative when your adorable little floofs are sleepy. Just watch this video and umm, we can't, we just can't with this. This is hilarious. View the original article to see embedded media.LOL! We love how mama to these pet ferrets is practically in tears in this video. It's just too funny. @BrittannyCC says "I just made this exact same noise laughing at this omfg." @ShaneMcneill adds "This made my day better thank you for the laugh those ferrets are so cute." @Tommy is as amused as we are "OH MY GOSH I LOST IT!! THE FREAKING GOOGLY EYES!!" So does anyone have some ferrets we can borrow? Not only are they adorable but they just made googly eyes that much more hilarious. Do you have a pet who's funny, smart, full of personality, or just downright adorable? We'd love for you to submit a video of your fur baby for a chance to be featured on PetHelpful and our social channels! Click here to upload your clip and share your beloved pet with the world. For more interesting pet news, be sure to sign up for our newsletter!
articles.title: Video of Hysterical Ferret Prank Has Us LOL-ing - Yahoo Life

articles.description: The Watcher. (L to R) Luke David Blumm as Carter Brannock, Bobby Cannavale as Dean Brannock in episode 102 of The Watcher. Cr. Eric Liebowitz/Netflix © 2022A new mystery-thriller series titled The Watcher is now streaming on Netflix. It follows a family who after moving into their dream home, begins receiving threatening letters from a mysterious stalker called “The Watcher.” While watching the series, you might start to have questions. Actually, a question we’re seeing being asked a lot revolves around a ferret.Spoilers from The Watcher ahead!We’re introduced to the ferret in episode 1. As the Brannock family moves into the 657 Boulevard house, Carter comes down the stairs carrying his pet ferret named Sprinkles. He asks Dean where the ferret’s leash is, and Dean replies that he doesn’t know. Then, Dean tells Carter not to let Sprinkles run all over the house because he doesn’t want them peeing everywhere. Later in the episode, we find out that Dean and Nora bought Carter the ferret to make him feel comfortable about moving into the new house.Flash forward further into the episode, Sprinkles escapes from their cage and ventures around the house as the Brannocks are asleep. But then the ferret is snatched up by a person with black gloves. So, what happens to Sprinkles? Do they die?Sadly, Sprinkles does die. The next morning, Carter gets up and walks out of his room to find Sprinkles bleeding profusely from their head. Then, the Brannocks call the police to find out who broke into their home and killed Sprinkles. The detective tells them there’s nothing he can do because there’s no proof that someone broke in. He continues and says that all the doors were locked, and there were no signs of forced entry. By the end of the season, we never find out who killed Sprinkles.The Watcher is now available to stream on Netflix.Here’s more content on The Watcher to check out!   Next: 5 good Netflix shows this weekend: The Watcher, The Sinner, and more
articles.title: Does the ferret die in The Watcher? - Netflix Life

articles.description:
The internet was in hysterics after a cat brought a ferret friend home to play.Cats are sometimes known to protect their personal space and are wary of anything that interferes with that, but in one instance, a cat appeared to have made friends with a neighborhood ferret and even brought him home for a snack.While ferrets are considered to be social animals - recommended to be kept in pairs - there are several considerations that should be factored in when introducing them to other species.File photo of cat and ferret. A man was shocked when his cat brought home someone else's pet ferret. 
Getty Images/DonnaOchoaPhotography / Irina Vasilevskaia
According to the Royal Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals Australia (RSPCAA), ferrets are strict carnivores and eat whole animals, in…

articles.description: BILLINGS — Life in the animal kingdom is tough, and bouncing back from the edge of extinction is even tougher. But that’s exactly what the black-footed ferret is trying to do with a little help from animal biologists."These animals genetically were down to seven animals. Only seven animals left that were breeding and so to know that their numbers are bouncing back, there’s about 300-400 out in the wild right now. It’s a true success story. We released 18 of these incredibly endangered, one of the most endangered animals in North America, back to their natural habitat and it was an amazing experience," said Jeff Ewelt, executive director at ZooMontana.Prior to 1981, most biologists believed the black-footed ferret was extinct, but that all changed one day on the Hog family ranch near Meetee…
articles.title: Black-footed ferrets getting a boost in population recovery in Wyoming - Q2 News

articles.description: BRYAN, Texas (KBTX) - It’s not every day that veterinarians at the Texas A&M Small Animal Teaching Hospital (SATH) get to sew a pacemaker onto a beating heart roughly the size of a grape!But when Hypnos, a 5-year-old ferret, arrived at the SATH with a very slow heart rate, his veterinary team took on the challenge of helping the beloved pet return home healthy to his owner and ferret friends. This was the first ferret pacemaker procedure at the SATH in almost 10 years.Copyright 2022 KBTX. All rights reserved.
articles.title: Treat of the Day: Ferret received lifesaving pacemaker at Texas A&M - KBTX

articles.description:
Glamour 😎 Portrait 📸
In a world where social media platforms like Instagram and Snapchat reign supreme, it’s no surprise that people are always looking for new ways to up their selfie game. After all, who doesn’t love a good selfie? Enter “glamour portraits.”
What is a glamour portrait, you ask? It’s a portrait that is taken in a more glamourous setting, with the purpose of capturing the subject’s beauty and radiance. Glamour portraits are all about making the person being photographed look and feel their absolute best.
Now, you might be thinking that you don’t need a professional photographer to take a glamour portrait of you. And you would be right! With the right pose, lighting, and filter, anyone can take a gorgeous glamour portrait.
Here are a few tips to help you get started:
1. Fi…
articles.title: Glamour 😎 Portrait 📸

articles.author: voiceferret
articles.description: I’m Bikke from Marshall Ferret and Butterscotch born on January 19, 2019. Ferret World Nakano store on April 15, 2019 … by I don’t know about you, but there have been times in my life when I’ve been so tired that I thought I would just wake up and go back to bed. It’s not uncommon to feel this way after a long day at work or a night out with friends. However, there are times when this feeling can be more intense and last for several days. If you find yourself in this situation, it’s important to listen to your body and get the rest you need.It can be hard to let go of the things you need to do in order to get some rest, but it’s important to remember that your health comes first. If you’re feeling exhausted, try to take a nap or go to bed early. And if you find yourself struggling to stay awake, don’t be afraid to ask for help. There’s no shame in admitting that you need some assistance.In short, don’t push yourself too hard if you’re feeling tired. Get the rest you need and take care of yourself. Your body will thank you for it.
articles.title: I thought I would wake up, but I went back to bed twice with all my strength

articles.description: A black-footed ferret kit takes its first look at freedom as it transitions from a holding pen to a plateau filled with white-tailed prairie dogs near Meeteetse. Prairie dogs are the main food source for the little mammals.     Mark Davis, Powell Tribune       State wildlife managers gave another boost last week to the black-footed ferret population being reestablished near Meeteetse.The Wyoming Game and Fish Department released 18 captive-born ferrets — 12 males and six females — into the northwestern part of the state, where the last known black-footed ferrets were discovered in the wild in 1981. Prior to the find, North America’s only native ferret species was believed to be extinct.After successfully establishing a self-sustaining ferret population in Shirley Basin over the last two-an…
articles.title: Eighteen black-footed ferrets released outside Meeteetse - Casper Star-Tribune

articles.description:
Toast climbed up onto me so I’d carry him once he got tired
Informal articles are not typically written in English. If you are writing informally in English, it is best to use simple language and sentences. However, if you want to write a formal article in English, it is important to use proper grammar and punctuation. An example of a formal article about toast climbing onto someone to be carried is provided below.
Carrying Toast
Toast loves to be carried around, but he knows that eventually he will tire out his owner. So, when he sees his owner sitting down, he climbs up onto them so they will carry him. This is a cute trick that Toast has learned and it always gets a smiles from his owner.
articles.title: Toast climbed up onto me so I’d carry him once he got tired

articles.description: Photo courtesy of the Wyoming Game and Fish Department.The Wyoming Game and Fish Department reports 18 black-footed ferrets were released last week on the historic recovery site near Meeteetse. Twelve male and six female captive-born ferrets were coaxed into burrows in their new wildlands home. The small mammal that was once thought to be extinct was rediscovered in Wyoming 41 years ago. Game and Fish has been working on their recovery since then. Game and Fish and U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service released the black-footed ferrets on private land. Partnerships with landowners in Wyoming have been key to the species recovery efforts, according to the department. “The Lazy BV and Pitchfork ranches are dedicated to black-footed ferrets and their success,” Game and Fish Nongame Supervisor Zack W…
articles.title: Game and Fish report the release of 18 black-footed ferrets on historic recovery site – Sheridan Media - Sheridan Media

articles.description: Eighteen black-footed ferrets were released recently at the animal's historic recovery site near Meeteetse, Wyoming.Twelve male and six female captive-born ferrets were coaxed into burrows in their new wildlands home. The small mammal that was once thought to be extinct was rediscovered in Wyoming 41 years ago. The Wyoming Game and Fish Department has been working on their recovery since then.In 1979, black-footed ferrets were considered extinct. In 1981, a ranch dog discovered a ferret in Meteetse, WY. This led to the discovery of a small population and the first recovery program. Today, the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service and its many partners are leading an effort to take ferrets off the Endangered Species List. This is their story. (Video courtesy of Wyoming Game and Fish Department) …
articles.title: 18 black-footed ferrets released near Meeteetse - Billings Gazette

articles.description: But people in power have a long history of bending science to fit their political agenda. The latest example, 4 species of bumble … OverviewThe debate over whether or not ferrets should be classified as domestic animals has been ongoing for many years, with arguments for and against both sides. Now, however, it appears that the scientific community is largely in agreement that ferrets should, in fact, be classified as domestic animals.The primary argument in favor of classifying ferrets as domestic animals is that they have been domesticated for centuries, and are significantly different from their wild ancestors. Ferrets were first domesticated in Europe over 2,000 years ago, and were brought to the United States in the 1800s. They have been bred in captivity for generations, and their be…
articles.title: Science demands Domestic Ferrets be Classified as Domestic Animals

articles.description: The Wyoming Game and Fish Department released 18 black-footed ferrets on the Meeteetse recovery site. (Wyoming Game and Fish)   CASPER, Wyo. — The Wyoming Game and Fish Department released 18 black-footed ferrets on the historic recovery site near Meeteetse last week, the department announced Monday.  The 12 male and six female ferrets born in captivity “were coaxed into burrows in their new wildlands home,” Game and Fish said. Black-footed ferrets were once thought extinct but were then rediscovered in Wyoming 41 years ago, and Game and Fish and the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service have been working to help the species recover.  Game and Fish released the 18 ferrets in an effort to maintain at least 35 ferrets at the Meeteetse recovery site, a baseline set by the U.S. FWS. The department ob…
articles.title: (PHOTOS) 18 black-footed ferrets released on historic Wyoming recovery site - Oil City News

articles.description: The Wyoming Game and Fish Department released 18 black-footed ferrets on the Meeteetse recovery site. (Wyoming Game and Fish)   CASPER, Wyo. — The Wyoming Game and Fish Department released 18 black-footed ferrets on the historic recovery site near Meeteetse last week, the department announced Monday.  The 12 male and six female ferrets born in captivity “were coaxed into burrows in their new wildlands home,” Game and Fish said. Black-footed ferrets were once thought extinct but were then rediscovered in Wyoming 41 years ago, and Game and Fish and the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service have been working to help the species recover.  Game and Fish released the 18 ferrets in an effort to maintain at least 35 ferrets at the Meeteetse recovery site, a baseline set by the U.S. FWS. The department ob…

articles.description:
Oh, hello there
In recent years, the English-speaking world has seen a surge in the use of the phrase “oh, hello there”. While its origins are unknown, it is clear that this phrase has become a part of popular culture.
There are many possible interpretations of the meaning of “oh, hello there”. It can be used as a polite way of acknowledging someone’s presence, or as a way of showing surprise. It can also be used as a way of initiating conversation, or as a way of showing interest in someone.
Whatever the intention behind it, “oh, hello there” is a phrase that is here to stay. So next time you see someone, why not try out this friendly greeting and see where it takes you?
articles.title: Oh, hello there

articles.author: voiceferret
articles.description: I’m Bikke from Marshall Ferret and Butterscotch born on January 19, 2019. Ferret World Nakano store on April 15, 2019 … Falling down the stairs is a hazard that many people face on a daily basis. This can be a particular problem if the stairs are in a public place, such as in a shopping centre or office block. Unfortunately, this is exactly what happened to me last week.I was descending a flight of stairs in my workplace when I suddenly lost my footing and tumbled all the way down, landing in an undignified heap at the bottom. Fortunately, I was not seriously injured, though I did suffer some bruising.This incident has led me to think about the safety of stairs in our society. Surely, there must be a better way to design them so that accidents like mine are less likely to happen? I would like to see a change in the way that stairs are built so that they are safer for everyone.
articles.title: I got battered in the middle of the stairs

articles.description:
My mega-chonker hambeast Kevin. He comes in at 4.3 pounds and is 2 feet long.
In today’s world, it’s not uncommon to see massive animals. But Kevin, my mega-chonker hambeast, takes the cake. He comes in at 4.3 pounds and is 2 feet long!
I adopted Kevin 8 months ago from a local shelter. At the time, he was a chonky boy, but he has truly blossomed into a magnificent hambeast. His thick fur is soft and luxurious, and he has the cutest little face.
 Kevin loves to eat, as you might expect. His favorite foods are carrots, apples, and bananas. He also enjoys the occasional ham bone. Kevin is very active and loves to play. He is especially fond of chasing his tail.
As you can see, Kevin is a very special animal. He brings joy to everyone who meets him. I am so lucky to have him in my life!
articles.title: My mega-chonker hambeast Kevin. He comes in at 4.3 pounds and is 2 feet long.

articles.author: voiceferret
articles.description: I’m Bikke from Marshall Ferret and Butterscotch born on January 19, 2019. Ferret World Nakano store on April 15, 2019 … We all know the saying, “April showers bring May flowers.” But what about the hidden gem of April- the moss! Too often we focus on the flowers and forget about the low-lying foliage that is essential to any garden.As we head into April, now is the time to start thinking about adding some moss to your landscape. Moss is a great way to add texture and interest to your garden. It can also help to control erosion on slopes and in shady areas where grass has a difficult time growing.If you’re thinking about adding moss to your garden, there are a few things to keep in mind. First, moss does best in cool, moist areas. so, if you live in a hot, dry climate, you may want to consider growing moss in a container instead of in your garden beds. Second, moss is a slow-growing plant, so be patient and be prepared to wait a few months for it to really start filling in.If you’re looking for a low-maintenance plant that will add a touch of beauty to your garden, consider moss. Just be sure to give it the cool, moist conditions it needs to thrive.
articles.title: Too much frolicking and moss

articles.author: voiceferret
articles.description: I’m Bikke from Marshall Ferret and Butterscotch born on January 19, 2019. Ferret World Nakano store on April 15, 2019 … If you had told me a year ago that I would be where I am today, I would have been surprised. A lot has changed in that time. I’ve gone from being a scared, shy person to someone who is confident and outgoing. I’ve made new friends and accomplished things that I never thought I could. I’m not the same person I was a year ago, and I’m grateful for that. I’m looking forward to seeing what the next year brings.
articles.title: I was surprised if I

articles.description:
Best of fwens 🙂
When it comes to finding the best friends, it is important to know what qualities to look for in a friend. A good friend should be someone who is loyal, honest, and supportive. They should also be someone who makes you laugh and is always there for you when you need them.
There are many different kinds of friends, and it is important to find the ones that best suit you. Some people prefer to have a small group of close friends, while others like to have a large group of friends. There is no right or wrong answer when it comes to the number of friends you have, but it is important to have friends that you can count on.

articles.title: Best of fwens :)

articles.author: The Modern Ferret
articles.description:
SURVEY TIME: Do you like hugs or hate em? The reason I ask is because I started a new job and it's almost a 50/50 split between people who look for excuses to hug just about everyone (me) and people who don't want to be touched with a ten-foot-pole.
(This illustration is from The Modern Ferret Emoji Sticker Pack, available for Android and Apple -check my link in bio!)(Feed generated with FetchRSS)
articles.title: Timeline photos

articles.description:
My brother sent this to me

“My brother sent this to me”
I was surprised when my brother sent me a text message with a link to a news article. The article was about a new type of cancer treatment that is showing promise in early clinical trials. He knows that I am interested in new developments in cancer research, so he thought I would find the article interesting. I did find it interesting, and I’m glad he sent it to me.
articles.title: My brother sent this to me

articles.author: voiceferret
articles.description: I’m Bikke from Marshall Ferret and Butterscotch born on January 19, 2019. Ferret World Nakano store on April 15, 2019 … If you’ve been waiting to take your computer in for service because you can’t find a babysitter for your ferret, you’re in luck. Your wait is almost over.On April 1, Best Buy will begin offering ferret check and pick-up service at all of its stores in the United States. The service, which is free of charge, will allow customers to drop off their computers for service and pick up their ferrets at the same time.According to Best Buy, the new service was created in response to customer feedback. “We know that our customers love their ferrets, but they also need their computers fixed,” said a spokesperson for the retailer. “This new service will make it easier for them to get both done at the same time.”To take advantage of the new service, customers can bring their ferrets to any Best Buy store during regular business hours. A Best Buy employee will then check the ferret for any health concerns and provide a temporary cage for the animal while the customer’s computer is being serviced.Once the computer is ready, the customer can pick up both the computer and the ferret at the customer service desk. Best Buy says the entire process should take about two hours.So if you’ve been putting off getting your computer fixed because you didn’t want to leave your furry friend behind, there’s no need to worry any longer. Best Buy has you covered.
articles.title: Get a ferret check and then pick up your computer

articles.author: The Modern Ferret
articles.description:
Introducing a new segment we're doing called Why Weasel Wednesday where we'll share things from you guys - out in the ferret community! I am looking forward to sharing your beautiful stories, particularly of times when your ferret has gotten you through a challenging time. I think this has the potential to help us all feel more connected and less alone during the ups and downs of life.
This week's is from @kayyy_sea -thank you so much for sharing. I’d love if people would comment some words of encouragement to her!
We will share another heartwarming story next Wednesday 
(Feed generated with FetchRSS)
articles.title: Photos from The Modern Ferret's post

articles.description:
My croissant 🥐
My croissant is the best! It’s fluffy and buttery and just perfect. I could eat it every day.
I’m not sure what it is about croissants that makes them so special, but they just are. They’re the perfect breakfast food or snack. And, they’re so easy to make!
If you’ve never had a croissant, you’re missing out. But, thankfully, they’re not hard to find. Most bakeries sell them, and you can even find them in some grocery stores.
So, next time you’re looking for something special, pick up a croissant. I promise, you won’t be disappointed.
articles.title: My croissant 🥐
